front.title: Session Initiation Protocol Service Example -- Music on Hold

abstract.t: The "music on hold" feature is one of the most desired features of telephone systems in the business environment. "Music on hold" is, when one party to a call has the call "on hold", that party's telephone provides an audio stream (often music) to be heard by the other party. Architectural features of SIP make it difficult to implement music-on-hold in a way that is fully compliant with the standards. The implementation of music-on-hold described in this document is fully standards-compliant, but is simpler than the methods previously documented.
